articles.author: ERIKA KINETZ and SOLOMIIA HERA
articles.description: DOVHENKE, Ukraine (AP) — The smell in the car is sick and sweet, the overpowering scent of corpses that have lain too long in muck and ruin, the ones the dogs didn’t devour. Oleksii Yukov, a 38-year-old martial arts instructor who leads a team of volunteer body collectors in Ukraine, doesn’t notice.
articles.title: The true toll of the war in Ukraine is measured in bodies. This man brings them home, one at a time

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Video and photos of suspects in a mass shooting show them apparently being brutalized by Russian security forces — without any rebuke from authorities.
articles.title: In the aftermath of the Moscow concert hall attack, is a harsher era under Putin in the works?

articles.author: JOHNSON LAI and KANIS LEUNG
articles.description: HUALIEN, Taiwan (AP) — Rescuers searched Thursday for dozens of people still missing a day after Taiwan's strongest earthquake in a quarter century damaged buildings, killed 10 people and left others stranded in remote areas.
articles.title: Rescuers in Taiwan search for those missing after major earthquake as death toll rises to 10

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: World Central Kitchen demanded an independent investigation into the Israeli strikes that killed seven of its staff in Gaza, as Israel faced growing isolation Wednesday over the deaths of six foreign aid workers and a Palestinian driver helping deliver desperately needed food to isolated and starving residents.
articles.title: The Latest | Food aid charity demands independent investigation of Israeli strikes

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden has faced protests over the conflict in Gaza all over the country, but this week he confronted one inside the White House itself.
articles.title: Biden faces protest over his support for Israel during White House meeting

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A judge on Wednesday rejected Donald Trump's bid to delay his April 15 hush money criminal trial until the Supreme Court rules on presidential immunity claims he raised in another of his criminal cases — spurning another of the former president's ploys to put off the historic trial.
articles.title: Judge rejects Donald Trump's request to delay hush-money trial until Supreme Court rules on immunity

articles.author: LORNE COOK and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — NATO marked on Thursday 75 years of collective defense across Europe and North America, with its top diplomats vowing to stay the course in Ukraine as better armed Russian troops assert control on the battlefield.
articles.title: NATO marks its 75th birthday as Russia's war in Ukraine gnaws at its unity

articles.author: DAVID A. LIEB
articles.description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. (AP) — Like a loss in the playoffs, voter rejection of a stadium tax plan will force the Kansas City Royals and Chiefs to reevaluate their approach.
articles.title: When voters say 'no' to new stadiums, what do professional sports teams do next?

articles.author: KELVIN CHAN
articles.description: Monday's total solar eclipse might become one of the most filmed and photographed events of the year.
articles.title: One Tech Tip: How to use apps to track and photograph the total solar eclipse

articles.description: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) — The Powerball jackpot has increased to an estimated $1.23 billion after another drawing without a big winner Wednesday night.The numbers selected were: 11, 38, 41, 62, 65 and the Powerball 15.
articles.title: Powerball jackpot jumps to $1.23 billion after another drawing without a big winner
